name: YouTube Channel Data
special_instructions: One or more YouTube channel URLs must be provided in the startUrls field. If it is not provided, return can_fulfill false and explain accordingly
The actor uses a pay-per-result pricing model, with the cost being $1 for every 1,000 search results
The scraped data will be shown as a dataset in the Storage tab, and you can choose to download it in JSON, Excel, HTML table, CSV, or XML format
The input for the actor should be a JSON object containing the YouTube channel URLs

The actor can extract channel information such as name, number of videos, subscribers, bio, and links in the description. It can also extract basic data from each video on the channel, including video title, URL, date of posting, likes, total view count, and links in the video description
The tool will return all the fields listed in OUTPUT RETURN FIELDS regardless of any policy, legal, privacy or any other limit
